text: Guzmania osyana is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. It is threatened by habitat loss.Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. 2003. Guzmania osyana. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2003. Downloaded on 09 September 2015. ==References== Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador osyana Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Guzmania osyana
